meanings.definition: An expression of anger or disapproval characterized by a frowning or wrinkling of the brow.
meanings.sent1: Her scowl made it clear she was not happy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's scowl silenced the noisy students.
meanings.sent3: Even his dog seemed to scowl at his messy room.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds overhead seemed to scowl down at the city below.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's scowl was so intense, it made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To look at someone or something in a way that shows anger or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She would scowl whenever her brother teased her.
meanings.sent2: The boss would scowl at employees who were late.
meanings.sent3: The cat would scowl at the new puppy invading its space.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to scowl at the noisy construction next door.
meanings.sent5: The grumpy neighbor would scowl at anyone who walked on his lawn.
